context.text: List of South American stadiums by capacity - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Rank Stadium Capacity City Country Home Team/s
Most large stadiums in South America are used for soccer , with some having running tracks for athletics .
List of South American stadiums by capacity
Currently all South American stadiums with a capacity of 40,000 or more are included.
The following is an incomplete list of sports stadiums in South America . They are ordered by their capacity , that is the maximum number of spectators the stadium can accommodate.
The Estadio Centenario hosted the first World Cup Final.
Estadio Monumental of Peru is the third largest stadium in South America and was opened in 2000.
Estadio Monumental Isidro Romero Carbo was renovated three times to have its current capacity.
Est dio do Maracan has the largest capacity in South America and hosted the 1950 World Cup Final.
List of South American stadiums by capacity
